3. The termination provisions in Section 4.2 only address termination "for cause" during the ongoing term with 30 days notice, but do not address termination of renewal periods. [Lines: 158-162]

Based on my comprehensive analysis of the document structure and targeted reading of relevant sections, I have identified several post-termination obligations that require legal review. Let me provide a complete analysis:

LEGAL ANALYSIS: This distributor agreement contains multiple categories of post-termination obligations that create continuing legal duties beyond the contract's expiration or termination. These provisions impose significant ongoing responsibilities on both parties that require careful legal analysis regarding scope, duration, and enforceability.

ANSWER: The following post-termination service obligations require lawyer review:

**1. PRODUCT REPURCHASE OBLIGATIONS (Section 4.4)**
- Company has optional right to repurchase products within 30 days of termination
- Mandatory repurchase obligation if Company terminates without cause (excluding distributor's failure to meet minimums)
- Distributor must deliver products on demand and tender of repurchase price
- Company bears shipping costs for repurchased products
- Company may offset indebtedness against repurchase price

**2. CONTINUED SALES RIGHTS (Section 4.4)**
- Distributor may continue selling remaining inventory post-termination
- Only applies to products Company has not repurchased
- Creates potential ongoing business relationship beyond contract term

**3. LICENSE TERMINATION (Section 1.2)**
- Immediate termination of right to use "Electric City of Illinois" name upon agreement termination
- Distributor must cease all business operations under licensed names
- No transition period provided for wind-down of branded operations

**4. NON-SOLICITATION OBLIGATIONS (Section 5.7)**
- 12-month post-termination prohibition on soliciting/hiring Company employees
- 18-month post-termination prohibition on interfering with Company business relations
- Prohibition on soliciting Company customers to purchase competitive products during 18-month period

**5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RESTRICTIONS (Section 5.6)**
- 3-year post-termination prohibition on challenging Company IP rights
- Extends to patents, copyrights, trademarks, and trade names
- Covers both existing and future IP rights

**6. ACCRUED OBLIGATIONS SURVIVAL (Section 4.3)**
- Termination does not relieve pre-termination obligations
- Parties remain liable for obligations incurred during contract performance
- Equitable relief provisions survive termination

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS (Section 3.6)**
- Confidentiality obligations continue "during the term of this Agreement or thereafter"
- No specified end date for confidentiality duties
- Trade secrets and business information remain protected indefinitely

CITATIONS:

2. "The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve either party hereto from obligations which have occurred pursuant to the provisions of this Agreement prior to its termination, nor shall it release either party hereto from any obligations which have been incurred as a result of operations conducted under this Agreement." [Line: 170]

"During the Term of this Agreement and for three years thereafter, the Distributor...agrees not to commence...any suit, action or proceeding contesting the ownership, validity or enforceability of any patent, copyright, trademark, trade name or other propriety right owned by or licensed to the Company" [Line: 210]
4. "During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of twelve (12) months thereafter, the Distributor...agrees that it will not directly or indirectly solicit or hire any executive, managerial or technical employee of the Company" [Line: 214]
5. "Distributor further agrees that it will not interfere...during the Term of the Agreement and for a period of eighteen (18) months thereafter" [Line: 220]
6. "Following expiration or termination of this Agreement, the Distributor may continue to sell any Products in the Market which are in its inventory and which the Company has not repurchased." [Line: 176]
